faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to the most common questions I receive before starting a project.

items.question: How long does it take to build a website or an application?
items.answer: A standard showcase website is usually delivered within one week on average. More advanced applications (SaaS platforms, internal tools, client dashboards, automations, etc.) take longer and begin with a short scoping phase to clearly define the requirements and timeline.

items.question: Can you improve or redesign an existing website?
items.answer: Yes. I frequently perform technical and UX audits, identify performance and SEO issues, and propose a structured redesign plan. The migration is handled smoothly to avoid downtime and to preserve your SEO.

items.question: Do you provide support after the website is launched?
items.answer: Yes. Every project includes 30 days of free adjustments after delivery. I also offer maintenance plans that cover updates, security patches, backups, and small improvements.

items.question: What technologies do you work with?
items.answer: I primarily work with Next.js, React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS on the front end. For the back end, I use Node.js (Fastify/Express) with Prisma, as well as modern platforms like Vercel, Supabase, or PlanetScale depending on your needs.

items.question: Can you handle everything if Iâ€™m not technical?
items.answer: Absolutely. I take care of the entire technical side: domain name, hosting, security, design integration, optimization, SEO, email setup, and more. You can focus solely on your business.

items.question: Do you also provide content, images, and SEO?
items.answer: Yes. I can write or refine your content, optimize your SEO, integrate your images or generate new ones using AI, and structure your pages to perform well from day one.

alertjo.description: Official gazette monitoring application with automated scraping and real-time email notifications.
alertjo.longDescription: Complete platform for monitoring French Official Gazette publications. Automatic PDF data extraction, advanced search and personalized notification system.

pcmge.description: Migration and redesign of a showcase website into a custom internal CRM for an SME.
pcmge.longDescription: Migration project of an existing PHP site to Laravel. Development of an internal CRM to manage clients and contacts. Bootstrap integration for a clean and responsive interface.

luxdrive.description: Premium car rental platform with reservation system, admin dashboard, and Stripe integration
luxdrive.longDescription: A comprehensive car rental management platform featuring a multi-step booking system, real-time vehicle availability, Stripe payment processing, admin dashboard for fleet and reservation management, multi-language support (FR/DE), email notifications, document verification, and invoice generation. Built with Next.js 15, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, and modern React patterns.
